Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization where both the objective function and constraints are linear.
Example: Maximizing profit with linear constraints on resources

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimization where some or all variables are restricted to be integers.
Example: Scheduling jobs with discrete time slots

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function or constraints are nonlinear.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: Linear optimization with both integer and continuous variables.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function is quadratic and constraints are linear.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Optimization where the objective function is convex and constraints form a convex set.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Method for solving problems by breaking them down into simpler subproblems.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty with probabilistic constraints or objectives.

Name: Multi-Objective Optimization
Description: Optimization with more than one conflicting objective.
Example: Balancing cost and performance in design

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Optimization over discrete, finite sets of solutions.
